p:
The proportion of other respiratory viruses like measles, adenovirus, coronaviruses and bocavirus was low in this study population. This is the first study to report HCoV OC43 from India, and this is only the second Indian study to document HCoV229E. These two coronaviruses have been shown to affect children causing pneumonia and croup leading to hospitalization.
32 Coronaviruses are more frequently reported from East and South East Asian countries like China, Hong Kong, Singapore,
33 but in India, the frequency remains low
34 ; this was confirmed in this study by their prevalence of <1%. Even during the 2012 outbreak of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome-Corona Virus (MERS-CoV), which caused nearly 487 deaths worldwide,
35 there were no cases reported from India, although one Mumbai resident, returning from the Middle East in August 2013, was suspected but tested negative.
36
